revision:
Volume of a combination of solids

  1. If an object is made up n different solids then ,volume of new solid = volume of 1 + volume of 2 + volume of 3 + ....., volume of n.
  2. Volume of a cylinder is=\(\pi \times r^2 \times h\), where h is the height of the cylinder
  3. Volume of a cone is=\(\frac 13 \times \pi \times r^2 \times h\), where h is the height of the cylinder
  4. Volume of a sphere is \(\frac 43 \times \pi \times r^3\)
  5. Volume of a cuboid= \(l\times b\times h\), where l is the length, b is the width and h is height of the cuboid.
